meanings.sent1: The colorful decorations jazzes up the room.
meanings.sent2: She always jazzes up her outfits with fun accessories.
meanings.sent3: Adding a touch of glitter really jazzes up the craft project.
meanings.sent4: His energetic dance moves jazzes up the party like fireworks in the sky.
meanings.sent5: The lively music jazzes up the atmosphere, making everyone want to dance.

meanings.definition: To add excitement or pizzazz to something
meanings.sent1: The surprise guest jazzes up the event.
meanings.sent2: The new paint color jazzes up the old furniture.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected plot twist really jazzes up the movie.
meanings.sent4: Her witty jokes jazzes up the conversation like a burst of confetti.
meanings.sent5: The sparkling fireworks jazzes up the night sky, creating a magical display.
